tagline: My name is Lukas Ingelheim and I am a full stack web developer
body:
### My profile
```
I am a dedicated team player, constantly learning and teaching,
who loves to tinker with new exciting stuff and has LOTS of fun doing so.
```

**Things I really like in tech:** Ruby, Javascript, HTML5, CSS3, Sinatra, Rails, Relational Databases, Active Record, Testing (Rspec, Jasmine), TDD,  Version Control (Git), Agile development, Object-oriented programming

**Things I currently tinker with:** Node.js, CoffeeScript, Arduino, New input devices (LeapMotion, MYO), Responsive design & Mobile first

**Other things I really like:** Business Idea Generation & Entrepreneurship, Gaming, Media, International Travel, Movies, Food, European & American history

**My current status:** Looking for a permanent `jr. software developer` position, starting in `fall 2013`
   
**My current location:** `Berlin / Hamburg / Munich, Germany`
**Prior locations:** Chicago, IL, USA / Berlin, Germany

**You can find me on**
[linkedin](http://www.linkedin.com/pub/lukas-ingelheim/14/718/5ab),
[github](https://github.com/Ingelheim/),
[twitter](https://twitter.com/LukasIngelheim),
[tumblr](http://lukasingelheim.tumblr.com/),
and [facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ingelheim)  
   
   
### I am dedicated
```
I took out a loan and moved from Berlin to Chicago to focus 4 months on coding.
I attended and graduated Dev Bootcamp Chicago and spent 90+ hours each week
studying modern full stack web technologies and pair programming.
```

### I am a fun team player
I love pair programming and I try to get most out of every pairing session. I have `good sense of humor`, an ability to `communicate well` and experience in interacting with `diverse international teams`. I am also willing to put in the time needed to `get the job done.`

_Anonymous comments from pairing partners I've paired with:_
```
"I really enjoyed pairing with you.
I like your hunger to not only produce the right code,
but understand the reasoning behind why that code works."

"Our styles are a little different,
but I get inspired by your tenacity and excitement about solving problems."

"Honestly, you're a pretty good partner to have. Keep it up!"
```

### I love learning and teaching

There is a saying in medical education that says that a procedure is best taught, by `seeing one`, `doing one` and `teaching it` to another person.

After learning myself from great mentors and peers in pairing sessions, I spent the last four weeks at Dev Bootcamp being a `teaching assistant` for younger students, primarily helping getting unstuck, `debugging` code and `refactoring` to achieve a better `code quality`.

Recently, I also became a coach/mentor for `Rails Girls Berlin`!

### I am curious
I am curious person and I am passionate about what I am doing!   
Here are `three facts` why:

**FACT 1:** My biggest hobby, _by far_, is the `generation of business ideas` and the creation of `prototypes.`

**FACT 2:** I love `traveling the globe`, `meeting new people` from all over the place, eating `interesting food` and visiting `cool places`.

**FACT 3:** `Tinkering` with `new exciting technologies` is awesome! Currently I am totally hooked on new input devices such as the `LeapMotion` or `MYO`.

  
### I have a round profile
Due to my prior experience `running an internet startup`, working at an `internet incubator` and `finance` and `consulting` experience, I have a round profile that extends the profile of just being technical.

- I can `communicate well`. Not only with technical, but `also non-technical people`
- I worked at a lot of clients before and can adapt pretty well to `new working environments`
- I did a lot of `financial modeling` and know how to `work within a budget`
- I am `empathic of clients` (internal and external) and have `business savvy` at the same time 
- I `led` and worked as `part of a team` before
   
If you are interested in my `resume` you can find it right [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/oubn07jgvajre3s/Resume_Lukas_Ingelheim.pdf)
